metadata.Title: CVE-2015-8842 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
tmpfiles.d/systemd.conf in systemd before 229 uses weak permissions for /var/log/journal/%m/system.journal, which allows local users to obtain sensitive information by reading the file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8842` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-myhostname - 229-4ubuntu1
libnss-mymachines - 229-4ubuntu1
libnss-resolve - 229-4ubuntu1
libpam-systemd - 229-4ubuntu1
libsystemd0 - 229-4ubuntu1
libudev1 - 229-4ubuntu1
systemd - 229-4ubuntu1
systemd-container - 229-4ubuntu1
systemd-coredump - 229-4ubuntu1
systemd-journal-remote - 229-4ubuntu1
systemd-sysv - 229-4ubuntu1
udev - 229-4ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> persistent journal not enabled by default in Ubuntu

criterions.comment: systemd package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '229-4ubuntu1').
